title: The Red Guys
content:
What name do you prefer for those read annoying giggling little lardbutts in the Pyramid of the Gnosticene Ancients?[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: The Red Guys
content: Gnosticene Ancients is a nifty name, and it does make congruent sense. But Tom says they're Treasure Eaters, so that's what I'll call them.

title: Re: The Red Guys
content:
Smirky. It's an unofficial name but I kind of like it. Before reading it for the first time I used to call them Gnosticene Ancients too. Then I read some people referred to them as Treasure Eaters, and now I read Tom Hall refers to them as that name too. But I'll stick with Smirky. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mort.gif[/img] ------------------------------

title: Re: The Red Guys
content: I like Smirky. Its the only one thats actually a name. The others just sound like ways to refer to them, like "Those treasure eating guys."-Genius314

title: Re: The Red Guys
content: I said Gnosticene Ancients, not because I like the name any more than the others (Smirky happens to be my favorite) but because that's what I've always called them.

title: Re: The Red Guys
content:
I myself prefer Smirky, it's a ice trendy name, I'm sure Mr Hall would like it if he knew of it.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: The Red Guys
content:
For long I thought them as Gnosticene Ancients, but now call them Treasure Eaters as I know the truth nowadays. When I was a kid I called them 'seals', even if they don't resemble one that much... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] But yes, too bad they aren't called something else instead of Treasure Eaters.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: The Red Guys
content:
I'm pretty sure you called them seals because of their inability to walk as other creatures; they jump with their big feet, which resemble seal's feet.

I wonder if this was what motivated Ceilick to mod them into squid creatures in his Keen 4 mod.------------------------------

title: Re: The Red Guys
content:
It wasn't me who first said they are Treasure Eaters. But I can't remember who the garg it was. Anyways, xtra's Beyond the Pogo mentions this e-mail too, and the data was written there already few years ago, I think. (Or it may even be from the original Keencyclopedia, which is even earlier.) Treasure Eater is the term I've heard is the right one, and told by Tom himself. If that's lie -- well, then it is, but as long as someone sends Tom e-mail about it again, I keep the e-mail in question to be true, and consider their name really is TE. This TE is NOT my invention. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
